com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.plugins.locationlayer

Class LocationLayerOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.plugins.locationlayer.LocationLayerOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Parcelable

    public class LocationLayerOptions
extends Object
implements Parcelable
    This class exposes options for the Location Layer Plugin. The options can be set by defining a style in your apps style.xml file and passing in directly into the LocationLayerPlugin class. Alternatively, if properties need to be changed at runtime depending on a specific state, you can build an instance of this class, setting the values you desire, and then passing it into either the LocationLayerPlugin constructor (if it isn't initialized yet) or LocationLayerPlugin.applyStyle(LocationLayerOptions).

    When the createFromAttributes(Context, int) methods called, any attributes not found inside the style will revert back to using their default set values. Likewise, when building a new LocationLayerOptions class using the builder, any options neglecting to be set will reset to their default values.

    If you would like to keep your custom style changes while modifying a single attribute, you can get the currently used options object using LocationLayerPlugin.getLocationLayerOptions() and it's toBuilder method to modify a single entry while also maintaining the other settings. Once your modifications have been made, you'll need to pass it back into the location layer plugin using LocationLayerPlugin.applyStyle(LocationLayerOptions).

    Since:
    0.4.0

    • Method Detail

      • createFromAttributes

        public static LocationLayerOptions createFromAttributes(Context context,
                                                        int styleRes)
        Construct a new Location Layer Options class using the attributes found within a style resource. It's important to note that you only need to define the attributes you plan to change and can safely ignore the other attributes which will be set to their default value.
        Parameters:
        context - your activity's context used for acquiring resources
        styleRes - the style id where your custom attributes are defined
        Returns:
        a new LocationLayerOptions object with the settings you defined in your style resource
        Since:
        0.4.0

      • toBuilder

        public LocationLayerOptions.Builder toBuilder()
        Takes the currently constructed LocationLayerOptions object and provides it's builder with all the values set matching the values in this instance. This allows you to modify a single attribute and then rebuild the object.
        Returns:
        the Location Layer builder which contains the values defined in this current instance as defaults.
        Since:
        0.4.0

      • builder

        public static LocationLayerOptions.Builder builder(Context context)
        Build a new instance of the LocationLayerOptions class with all the attributes set automatically to their defined defaults in this library. This allows you to adjust a few attributes while leaving the rest alone and maintaining their default behavior.
        Parameters:
        context - your activities context used to acquire the style resource
        Returns:
        the Location Layer builder which contains the default values defined by the style resource
        Since:
        0.4.0

        public float accuracyAlpha()

        Returns:
        the drawable resource ID

      • backgroundStaleName

        public String backgroundStaleName()
        String image name, identical to one used in the first parameter of com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.maps.MapboxMap#addImage(String, Bitmap), the plugin, will used this image in place of the provided or default mapbox_foregroundDrawableStale.

        A maki-icon name (example: "circle-15") may also be provided. These are images that can be loaded with certain styles. Note, this will fail if the provided icon name is not provided by the loaded map style.

        Returns:
        String icon or maki-icon name
        Since:
        0.6.0

      • foregroundDrawableStale

        public int foregroundDrawableStale()
        Defines the drawable used for the stale foreground icon.
        Returns:
        the drawable resource ID
        Since:
        0.4.0

        A maki-icon name (example: "circle-15") may also be provided. These are images that can be loaded with certain styles. Note, this will fail if the provided icon name is not provided by the loaded map style.

        Returns:

      • enableStaleState

        public boolean enableStaleState()
        Enable or disable to stale state mode. This mode indicates to the user that the location being displayed on the map hasn't been updated in a specific amount of time.
        Returns:
        whether the stale state mode is enabled or not
        Since:
        0.4.0

      • staleStateTimeout

        public long staleStateTimeout()
        Set the delay before the location icon becomes stale. The timer begins approximately when a new location update comes in and using this defined time, if an update hasn't occured by the end, the location is considered stale.
        Returns:
        the duration in milliseconds which it should take before the location layer is considered stale
        Since:
        0.4.0

      • padding

        public int[] padding()
        Sets the distance from the edges of the map view’s frame to the edges of the map view’s logical viewport.

        When the value of this property is equal to {0,0,0,0}, viewport properties such as `centerCoordinate` assume a viewport that matches the map view’s frame. Otherwise, those properties are inset, excluding part of the frame from the viewport. For instance, if the only the top edge is inset, the map center is effectively shifted downward.

        Returns:
        integer array of padding values
        Since:
        0.5.0

      • maxZoom

        public double maxZoom()
        The maximum zoom level the map can be displayed at.
        Returns:
        the maximum zoom level
        Since:
        0.5.0

      • minZoom

        public double minZoom()
        The minimum zoom level the map can be displayed at.
        Returns:
        the minimum zoom level
        Since:
        0.5.0

      • maxZoomIconScale

        public float maxZoomIconScale()
        The scale factor of the location icon when the map is zoomed in. Based on maxZoom(). Scaling is linear.
        Returns:
        icon scale factor
        Since:
        0.6.0

      • minZoomIconScale

        public float minZoomIconScale()
        The scale factor of the location icon when the map is zoomed out. Based on minZoom(). Scaling is linear.
        Returns:
        icon scale factor
        Since:
        0.6.0

      • trackingInitialMoveThreshold

        public float trackingInitialMoveThreshold()
        Minimum single pointer movement in pixels required to break camera tracking.
        Returns:
        the minimum movement
        Since:
        0.5.0

      • trackingMultiFingerMoveThreshold

        public float trackingMultiFingerMoveThreshold()
        Minimum multi pointer movement in pixels required to break camera tracking (for example during scale gesture).
        Returns:
        the minimum movement
        Since:
        0.5.0
